intro: Centropogon crassifolius var. ovatifolius, commonly known as the broad-leaved centropogon, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces clusters of showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, attracting various pollinators. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique foliage, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by plant enthusiasts.
